lead_paragraph: GOLDBERG--Marion H. 77, passed away peacefully on March 22, 2016 at her home in Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, FL. Marion was a former Director of Training for the Department of Probation of the City of New York. She was born in Brooklyn, New York to Solomon Goldberg and Anna Palter, emigrants from Warsaw and Bialystock, Poland. While growing up, Marion lived with her family in the Bronx and attended City College of New York, where she graduated with a BA in 1959. As a young lady she lived in Manhattan. After her marriage in 1987, she and her husband resided in East Windsor, NJ, Saratoga, CA, Washington DC, and Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, FL. In Florida she was active as Secretary of Our Art-By- The-Sea, a local Artists Club. Marion is survived by her husband of 28 years, Eduardo 'Ed' Elizondo, cousins Meyer Stiskind of New York City, Eileen Hirschfeld of Boynton Beach, FL, Zena Kovack of West Hartford, CT, and their respective families. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GOLDBERG, MARION H
